meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of a recession
meanings.sent1: The recessionary economy led to job losses.
meanings.sent2: During a recessionary period, businesses struggle to survive.
meanings.sent3: The recessionary budget made planning the company picnic a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as recessionary as the stock market crash.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds overhead mirrored the recessionary atmosphere.

meanings.definition: causing or likely to cause a recession
meanings.sent1: The recessionary policies of the government sparked economic concerns.
meanings.sent2: Investors feared the recessionary effects of the new trade tariffs.
meanings.sent3: His reckless spending habits were recessionary for his savings account.
meanings.sent4: The looming threat of layoffs was as recessionary as a storm on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The decision to cut funding proved to be a recessionary move for the arts community.

meanings.definition: experiencing or marked by a recession
meanings.sent1: The recessionary city saw a rise in unemployment rates.
meanings.sent2: Businesses in the recessionary region struggled to stay afloat.
meanings.sent3: The recessionary neighborhood banded together to support local businesses.
meanings.sent4: The once bustling streets now wore a recessionary silence.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned factories stood as a stark reminder of the recessionary past.
